intro: Hieraciodes hierosolymitana, commonly known as the Holy Land hieracium, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow or pale yellow in color. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptability to drought conditions.
